blocks.name: cvtx
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the vertices of "graphs".

blocks.name: diff.cvtx.s
diff.cvtx.c
diff.cvtx.w
ciedg
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the indexed edges of "graphs".

blocks.name: diff.ciedg.s
diff.ciedg.c
diff.ciedg.w
df-vtx
blocks.content: Define the function mapping a graph to the set of its vertices. This definition is very general: It defines the set of vertices for any ordered pair as its first component, and for any other class as its "base set". It is meaningful, however, only if the ordered pair represents a graph resp. the class is an extensible structure representing a graph. (Contributed by AV, 9-Jan-2020.) (Revised by AV, 20-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: df-iedg
blocks.content: Define the function mapping a graph to its indexed edges. This definition is very general: It defines the indexed edges for any ordered pair as its second component, and for any other class as its "edge function". It is meaningful, however, only if the ordered pair represents a graph resp. the class is an extensible structure (containing a slot for "edge functions") representing a graph. (Contributed by AV, 20-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: vtxval
blocks.content: The set of vertices of a graph. (Contributed by AV, 9-Jan-2020.) (Revised by AV, 21-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm vtxval(class c0) {
  |- wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), cif(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(cbs, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe))))
} = {
  pm2.61i(wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), cif(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(cbs, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe)))), wcel(c0, universe))
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, universe, cvtx, cif(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(cbs, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe))), cif(cfv(c1st, cv(hs0)), cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cxp(universe, universe))))
  ifbieq12d(cfv(c1st, cv(hs0)), cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(cbs, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cxp(universe, universe)), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe)))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), c0, cxp(universe, universe))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, c1st)
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, cbs)
  df-vtx(hs0)
  ifex(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(cbs, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe)))
  fvex(c1st, c0)
  fvex(cbs, c0)
  3eqtr4rd(cfv(cvtx, c0), cif(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(cbs, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe))), cfv(cbs, c0), emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  fvprc(c0, cbs)
  iffalsed(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(cbs, c0), wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe)))
  prcnel(c0, cxp(universe, universe))
  fvprc(c0, cvtx)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(cif(cfv(c1st, c0), cfv(cbs, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe))))
}

blocks.name: iedgval
blocks.content: The set of indexed edges of a graph. (Contributed by AV, 21-Sep-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm iedgval(class c0) {
  |- wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), cif(cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cedgf, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe))))
} = {
  pm2.61i(wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), cif(cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cedgf, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe)))), wcel(c0, universe))
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, universe, ciedg, cif(cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cedgf, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe))), cif(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), cfv(cedgf, cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cxp(universe, universe))))
  ifbieq12d(cfv(c2nd, cv(hs0)), cfv(cedgf, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cedgf, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cxp(universe, universe)), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe)))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), c0, cxp(universe, universe))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, c2nd)
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, cedgf)
  df-iedg(hs0)
  ifex(cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cedgf, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe)))
  fvex(c2nd, c0)
  fvex(cedgf, c0)
  3eqtr4rd(cfv(ciedg, c0), cif(cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cedgf, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe))), cfv(cedgf, c0), emptycls, wn(wcel(c0, universe)))
  fvprc(c0, cedgf)
  iffalsed(cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cedgf, c0), wn(wcel(c0, universe)), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe)))
  prcnel(c0, cxp(universe, universe))
  fvprc(c0, ciedg)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(cif(cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(cedgf, c0), wcel(c0, cxp(universe, universe))))
}

blocks.name: 1vgrex
blocks.content: A graph with at least one vertex is a set. (Contributed by AV, 2-Mar-2021.)
